item.title: Better Ladders [Delta][Winterlove based servers]
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

That wasn’t an insult, at least it wasn’t intended to be.
i wuv u arharm

Just implying that it really isn’t your place to correct others conventions when you just used eclipse, that is all. Not insulting you, by any means.

EDIT: Don’t take it so personal either, I would have said that to anybody.

Read full topic

item.title: Better Ladders [Delta][Winterlove based servers]
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:7, topic:464737”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=568850.msg4129608#msg4129608 date=1350907975]
I suggest fixing you lining.

	public void climbLadder(final int x, final int y, final int h, int objX,
			int objY, int objH) {
		if (WithinDistance(absX, absY, objX, objY, 1) && heightLevel == objH) {
			setAnimation(Constants.LADDER);

			server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(2, false) {
				@Override
				protected void execute() {
					toX = x;
					toY = y;
					heightLevel = h;
					stop();
				}
			});
		} else {
			sendMessage("I can't reach that!");
		}
	}

More tidy :).
[/quote]
Don’t try to correct others conventions when you still rely on Eclipse to get the job done.[/quote]
Is all you do insult me? I mean, seriously, it’s annoying. I don’t see anything I’ve done to you to make you just chase me around.

Read full topic

item.title: Better Ladders [Delta][Winterlove based servers]
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Uses Grahams cycle based task manager.

method

[code] public void climbLadder(final int x, final int y, final int h, int objX, int objY, int objH)
{
if(WithinDistance(absX, absY, objX, objY, 1) && heightLevel == objH)
{
setAnimation(Constants.LADDER);

		server.getTaskScheduler().schedule(new Task(2, false) 
		{
			@Override
			protected void execute() 
			{
					toX = x;
					toY = y;
					heightLevel = h;
					stop();
			}
		});
	} else {
		sendMessage("I can't reach that!");
	}
}[/code]

result


will throw an error, common sense fix if you know what you’re doing. 828 is emote.

Read full topic
